item.title: Project Mantis: Go-Based Evasion Loader
item.description:
Project Status: [Active Development]

Abstract

Mantis is a research project focused on bypassing modern EDR static analysis and userland hooking. Unlike C++ based loaders which are heavily signatured, Mantis leverages the Go runtime’s structure to obfuscate shellcode execution.

Core Objectives

  1. Syscall Unhooking: Implementing direct syscalls to bypass AV/EDR hooks in ntdll.dll.
  2. Sandbox Evasion: Heuristic checks (CPU cores, RAM, Uptime) to detect analysis environments before payload decryption.
  3. Obfuscation: Using Go’s massive binary size and custom packers to lower entropy and evade static signatures.

Technical Architecture

  • Language: Go (Golang) + C (cgo for specific API calls)
  • Encryption: AES-256-GCM for payload protection.
  • Execution Method: VirtualAlloc -> RtlMoveMemory -> CreateThread (Classic injection, currently being refactored for Halo’s Gate).

Development Log

  • [2025-11-20]: Initial repository setup. Validating AES decryption routine.
  • [Todo]: Implement Halo’s Gate for dynamic syscall resolution.

Source code will be released upon completion of the evasion module.
